events.message: The insured reported a car collision that occurred at an intersection involving their vehicle and another car.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial report and the description of the incident.
An agent was assigned to handle the vehicle collision claim promptly to ensure smooth processing for the customer.
The claimant was promptly notified that their vehicle claim has been acknowledged and is now under review.
To proceed with the investigation, the customer was requested to submit photos of the damage and a police report.
The claimant submitted all required documents including photographs of the damaged vehicle and the official collision report.
An investigation was initiated to verify the facts of the auto accident and assess the extent of damages to the vehicle.
The investigation concluded confirming the insured was not at fault and recommended a full repair coverage.
A settlement offer was proposed covering the full estimated repair costs for the insured vehicle resulting from the accident.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the quick response and clear communication throughout the claim process.
The claim was officially approved based on the investigation results and the settlement terms agreed upon.
The payment for the vehicle repairs was issued to the insuredâ€™s repair shop to enable prompt service and repair.
Following payment issuance and confirmation of repair work completion, the auto accident claim was officially closed.
The finalized claim documents and correspondence were archived for future reference and regulatory compliance.
